channel.title: I have a couple of things i need help with!
channel.description:
Well, i have no idea where to start to trying to fix this. 1.> Im trying to change the Ape atoll teleport to somewhere else. After that, how do i change the name on the magic tab from ape atoll to skilling?
2.> how do make admin zones and the commands to get there?
Thank you in advance!

item.title: I have a couple of things i need help with!
item.dc:creator: @j19283746 j19283746
item.description:
@j19283746 wrote:

[quote=“jal knight, post:5, topic:348511”]Im sorry, im not real sure what you mean. when you say texthandler class, are you talking about .class or .java?

im trying. i want into texthandler.java found ape atoll and i went into clicking.java. but couldnt find any codes i found in texthandler.

Lol im lost. im sorry.

Thank you sooo much for helping![/quote]
You can never open up class files. Java files are the only ones that and readable and change-able.

Read full topic

item.title: I have a couple of things i need help with!
item.dc:creator: @j19283746 j19283746
item.description:
@j19283746 wrote:

[quote=“Superd00d, post:3, topic:348511”]1) clickingMost class.
texthandler class.
2) pick an area.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("adminzone") && playerRights >=2)) { toX = XXXX; toY = YYYY; }
^ Modify that code yourself. I don’t use Delta.[/quote]

Wrong. You can’t always locate the Sendquest ID’s in the ClickingMost.java
Take my server for instance, It has no ClickingMost whatsoever. Almost everything Is located in the client.java file. Then you just gotta find the correct Sendquest ID.

Read full topic

item.title: I have a couple of things i need help with!
item.dc:creator: @CookieScape CookieScape
item.description:
@CookieScape wrote:

Uhmm, I’ll check if I have the command, check back I’ll edit this post.

Got it. if (command.startsWith("staffzone") && playerRights > 2) { toX = 2981; toY = 9913; sM("Welcome to "Server Names" Staff Room."); }

If it gives you 100 errors add a bracket or something.

item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

ok, so i just clicked the tele button and when i teleed there i did the ::mypos and it gave that to me. so i searched for the coords in there and found it! Thanks! now, how do i make the command “adminzone”

Read full topic
item.source: I have a couple of things i need help with!

item.title: I have a couple of things i need help with!
item.dc:creator: @CookieScape CookieScape
item.description:
@CookieScape wrote:

It might be clicking.java or actionbuttons.java. As for the not knowing the button id, just use the teleport, do ::mypos, get the coords, go into clickingmost.java and search for something like c.triggerTele(xxxx, yyyy, 0); If you don’t find anything, your triggertele might be different, so just search xxxx, yyyy. If you don’t find it with that, it could be that your tele’s are like telex (xxxx) teley(yyyy) or something like that. In that case just search for one of the coords until you find the one with both coords the same as the teleport you want to change, then just change the coords.

Read full topic
item.source: I have a couple of things i need help with!

item.source: I have a couple of things i need help with!

item.title: I have a couple of things i need help with!
item.dc:creator: @CookieScape CookieScape
item.description:
@CookieScape wrote:

To find it in clickingmost.java, click the teleport button, and in the cmd for the server, it should say button clicked: button ID. Button ID being a number of course. Search for the number in clickingmost.java, for example, if the number is 16266, search for case 16266 in clickingmost.java.

This is roughly what it will look like. This is my safepk teleport

case 59136: if(c.interfaceGame == 3) c.triggerTele(3303, 3123, 0); //safewild

The case is the button id, the c.triggerTele(3303, 3123, 0); is the coords, if you need more tell me.

Read full topic
